MedPlus Rajarajeshwari Nagar.medicine_desc: A combination antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.
A proton pump inhibitor and prokinetic agent, used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammatory conditions.
A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces the amount of acid produced in the stomach.
A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina.
A combination drug with enzymes and NSAIDs to relieve swelling (edema) and pain.
An antiseptic gel (chlorhexidine) to treat gingivitis, mouth ulcers, and oral infections.
A combination painkiller, often containing an NSAID and paracetamol, for moderate pain.
A cough syrup or tablet formulation for relieving cough, cold, and allergy symptoms.
Often a brand name for progesterone or a protein supplement.
A supplement containing Calcium and Vitamin D3, used to treat or prevent bone loss.
A supplement, often containing glucosamine, aimed at supporting cartilage and joint health.
A carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used as eye drops to lower pressure inside the eye.
An H2 receptor blocker that reduces stomach acid. Less common now.
A non-selective beta blocker, less commonly used now, for hypertension.
Commonly used to treat fever and mild to moderate pain.
A statin used to lower cholesterol and triglycerides.
An oral medication that helps control blood sugar levels.
A calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure.
An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
An antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.
Used to prevent wheezing and difficulty breathing caused by asthma.
An ARB used to treat high blood pressure.
An SSRI antidepressant used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces stomach acid.
An antiplatelet medicine used to prevent blood clots.
A newer antihistamine, considered non-drowsy.
A prokinetic agent used to treat nausea and vomiting.
A common NSAID used for pain relief, fever, and inflammation.
Used to treat epilepsy, anxiety, and neuropathic (nerve) pain.
An alpha-blocker used by men to treat the symptoms of an enlarged prostate (BPH).
A non-drowsy antihistamine for seasonal allergies.
A sulfonylurea drug that helps the pancreas produce more insulin.
A beta-blocker that affects the heart and circulation.
An immunosuppressive drug used to prevent organ rejection after a transplant.
Used to treat and prevent gout attacks.
An anti-epileptic drug used to control seizures.
A powerful vitamin A derivative used to treat severe cystic acne.
Reduces the production of uric acid in the body, preventing gout.
An immunosuppressant used for rheumatoid arthritis and some cancers.
An antiviral medication used to treat Hepatitis C.
An anticoagulant (LMWH) injection used to prevent deep vein thrombosis.
A monoclonal antibody used to treat certain autoimmune diseases and cancers.
An antiemetic used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy or surgery.
An anticonvulsant used to treat epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and neuropathic pain.
Eye drops used to control the progression of glaucoma by reducing intraocular pressure.
An immunosuppressant used to prevent organ rejection.
A biologic drug (TNF inhibitor) used for autoimmune conditions.
An antiviral medication used to treat herpes simplex, chickenpox, and shingles.
